Package mars.riscv.instructions.ecalls

Class Tone

  • java.lang.Object
    • mars.riscv.instructions.ecalls.Tone
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    class Tone
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Contains important variables for a MIDI Tone: pitch, duration instrument (patch), and volume. The tone can be passed to a thread and will be played using MIDI.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DEFAULT_CHANNEL
      The default MIDI channel of the tone: 0 (channel 1).
      static int TEMPO
      Tempo of the tone is in milliseconds: 1000 beats per second.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tone

        public Tone​(byte pitch,
            int duration,
            byte instrument,
            byte volume)
        Instantiates a new Tone object, initializing the tone's pitch, duration, instrument (patch), and volume.
        Parameters:
        pitch - the pitch in semitones. Pitch is represented by a positive byte value - 0-127 where 60 is middle C.
        duration - the duration of the tone in milliseconds.
        instrument - a positive byte value (0-127) which represents the instrument (or patch) of the tone. See the general MIDI instrument patch map for more instruments associated with each value.
        volume - a positive byte value (0-127) which represents the volume of the initial attack of the note (MIDI velocity). 127 being loud, and 0 being silent.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run​()
        Plays the tone.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
